definitions.definition: To commit an offence ; to sin .
To go too far ; to put someone to inconvenience by demand or importunity; to intrude .
examples: to trespass upon the time or patience of another

definitions.definition: To enter someone else's property illegally .
To pass beyond a limit or boundary; hence, to depart; to go.

To subject [someone] to a trespass notice , formally notifying them that they are prohibited from entry to a property, such that any current or future presence there will constitute trespass, ( especially ) criminal trespass
examples: The dean trespassed the streaker from his university.

main_definition: ( intransitive , now rare ) To commit an offence ; to sin .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , obsolete ) To offend against, to wrong (someone).
( intransitive ) To go too far ; to put someone to inconvenience by demand or importunity; to intrude .
( law ) To enter someone else's property illegally .
( obsolete ) To pass beyond a limit or boundary; hence, to depart; to go.

( transitive , law , especially New Zealand ) To subject [someone] to a trespass notice , formally notifying them that they are prohibited from entry to a property, such that any current or future presence there will constitute trespass, ( especially ) criminal trespass
